job_description: Sr. Software Engineer for ADAS Data Engineering - job post SpanIdea Systems 309 1st Ln, South San Francisco, CA 94080 $109,549 - $135,000 a year -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $109,549 - $135,000 a year Job Type Contract Sr. Software Engineer for ADAS Data Engineering Location: SF Bay Area Long Term Contract Educational Requirements: MS or Ph.D in the areas of Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Automotive Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, or other related fields Ability to code, debug, test services in C++, Python, Golang Package services in containers, and deploy them to cloud on container management systems like Kubernetes Do Performance analysis , profiling of applications to figure out bottlenecks for scalability. Familiarity with profiling tools for C++, Golang, Python a plus Document and provide full traceability to code written. Write meaningful test cases for code Understand build and debug toolchains for C++,Golang on various OS like Ubuntu, Windows and ability to consume and interact with libraries and utilities written by low level embedded teams Strong understanding of unix shell environment and ability to write, debug and validate shell scripts for ECU, sensor lifecycle management Requirements Qualifications: Strong programming skills in C/C++, Python, and software design Experience in large data set processing and familiarity with real time systems Solid experience in a fast-paced and structured engineering environment At least 3 years relevant software engineering experience is preferred. Knowledge of autonomous sensor data is preferred Knowledge and experience with automotive communication protocols such as CAN, LIN, UDS and related tools to measure and command signals, though scripting or otherwise. Ability to thrive under pressure, ambiguity and time constraints Job Type: Contract Pay: $109,549.27 - $135,000.00 per year Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Work Location: One location If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Connected SW Platform – Sr. Software Engineer - Backend and V&V (Multi-year contract opportunity) - job post Volkswagen Group of America - Chattanooga Operations Belmont, CA • Hybrid remote $118,000 - $160,000 a year -  Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $118,000 - $160,000 a year Job Type Contract Connected SW Platform – Sr. Software Engineer - Backend and V&V (Multi-year contract opportunity) - ECC000208 - Hybrid On-Site Primary Location United States-California-Belmont VW. Two letters. Endless opportunities. A bright future. Innovation. Sophistication. Optimization. This is our Passion. Senior Software Engineer – Backend and V&V (Multi-year Contract opportunity) Worldwide, the Volkswagen Group has a long tradition of dramatic innovations. The Volkswagen Group with its headquarters in Wolfsburg is one of the world’s leading automobile manufacturers and the largest carmaker in Europe. The Group comprises of twelve brands from seven European countries: Volkswagen Passenger Cars, Audi, SEAT, ŠKODA, Bentley, Bugatti, Lamborghini, Porsche, Ducati, Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles, Scania and MAN. Here in the US, we are blending German engineering with American ingenuity. Located in the heart of Silicon Valley, the Volkswagen Innovation and Engineering Center California (IECC) is becoming the epicenter of vehicle electronics expertise in North America. Comprised of twelve teams, the IECC works with researchers and development teams in the US, Germany and across the globe. We are a team of engineers, designers, scientists, and psychologists looking to develop innovations for future generations of cars, and to transfer technologies from many industries and research institutions into the automotive domain. Our mission is to drive change, which means we are not only impacting one of the world’s largest carmakers, but also the lives of millions of people. Are you ready to join us? Role Responsibilities Develop innovative SW solutions that advance end-to-end connected car platform & use-cases Participate in the SW development and V&V activities using MATLAB, Python, R, etc. Work in cross functional development environment to create simulations and co-simulations SW Conceptualize and implement systems and data flows, which can cater to the needs of specific project, ask to articulate development and inference. Obtain patents and publish research in prestigious journals and conferences Periodic software updates & testing using SW V&V principals or formal methods System troubleshooting and maintenance Required Skills Experience with container-based development and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes) Working knowledge of hardware design for embedded applications (e.g. NVIDIA Jetson) Working experience with Python and MATLAB/Simulink Experience with SW development focused on mathematical and physics based modeling Experience with key CI/CD principles and technologies Software development & programming language proficiency (Python, C++, Java, etc) Mastery of key development tools such as Git Familiarity with collaboration tools such as Jira and Confluence or similar Education and Skills Requirements PhD (preferred) or Masters in Electrical, Computer Science, Mechanical or related field Master’s Degree (or equivalent) with 3+ years of related experience In Belmont, California, the salary range for this role is $118000 – $160000, depending on education and experience. We are proud to be an EEO employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. #LI-CK1 #LI-HYBRID

Senior Software Engineer, 5G - Systems - job post Experfy Inc San Francisco, CA Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Contract What you ll be doing: Design, develop, enhance, and maintain wireless algorithms and software for 5G radio access networks and other advanced technologies. Will take ownership of PHY or MAC layer algorithms and their implementation in C/C+ . Participate in architecture, design, and code reviews and provide peer feedback on a continuous basis. Engage with customer field trials and technical teams. Engage with wireless research and open source communities. What we need to see: Our ideal candidate has a wireless communication systems or digital signal processing background, a passion for building real-world carrier-grade communication systems, and industry experience developing PHY/MAC layer software in C/C++. Bachelors, Masters or PhD in a related technical discipline (or equivalent experience). 10+ years industry experience. Expertise of the PHY/MAC layer procedures, expected behavior, and typical performance tradeoffs, as well as overall system performance . Background with LTE/5G MAC and PHY from both systems and low-level 3GPP spec point of view. Programming for design and development of wireless software including stellar debugging skills. Ability to switch between high-level systems view and low-level detail view of complex wireless systems. Comfortable using wireless lab equipment such as signal generators, network analyzers, power meters, etc. A bility to work as an individual contributor or take a technical leadership role SIMD based architecture use in signal processing is a plus. Knowledge of Massive MIMO impact on 5G radio access network is a plus. Exposure to CUDA/GPU programming is a plus. If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
